text: the pub is spacious with ample room inside, featuring long tables that are perfect for large groups. they also have numerous screens of various sizes where they can project matches. the menu includes beer, cocktails, and food options such as burgers and sandwiches.
huuuge place! great food, (huuuge) beer. it's more party than evening dinner. absolutely recommended.

*must have a mask to walk-in*
what a spectacular party venue for anyone looking to socialize with your friends, or if you‚Äôre feeling bold, mingle with any nearby parties sitting by you. the beer was fairly cheap & big, & the free popcorn was not stale.

their big mug san miguel beers are about 4 euros, craft beers like brutus beers are about 6 euros (pictured, tasted like an american budweiser), & their gallon pitchers of san miguel are 35 euros.

a great atmosphere that can be both chill & fun!
key_phrases: ['san miguel beers', 'brutus beers', 'craft beers', 'free popcorn', 'party venue']

text: good beer

huge place. i was there as part of a very large group, maybe over 200 people and the venue seemed to cope just fine. we had a fixed taps menu which was tasty and well presented. big tanks of beer and sangria on the tables, so no wait for drinks.

place is in old industry building, except that everything else is mediocre, the do not have more than 2 two draft beers!! (they didn't even had their own beer so only one when i visited...) they do have imported bottled ones, but that is not the reason to visit this place, if you like san miguel piss then go ahead.
new craft beer tavern downstairs in l‚Äôovella negra marina, awsome place!
good beer bar üòÅ ,  where we admired a beauteful intimist flamenco with the joaquim 's family üòä!!! that i really recommend warmly !!!!
favourite beer pub in barcelona! awesome ambience. unpretentious. price/quality ratio is great.
favourite beer pub in barcelona! awesome ambience. unpretentious. price/quality ratio is great.

the beer isn't great but it is cheapish, san miguel (‚Ç¨3). the ambience is that of a students or erasmus bar, a lot of travellers or younger people who come for the cheap beer and sangria (which is considerably better). large open places, music varies depending where you are, reasonably clean and staff are amicable. it's perfectly ok.

really fun bar, we got these "beer towers" that were 31‚Ç¨ each, we got 4 of them for 20 people and we were all pretty tipsy by the end of it. they seem like a great deal. the building is awesome too, it's a old  wearhouse converted to the bar so it's very industrial while still being very fun

very good and cheap beer. popular with students and young people. it's located a bit in a suburban area (there's nothing around it) but it has a very good atmosphere. pints of san miguel are ‚Ç¨2.90 and  you get a small bowl of popcorn with it (don't forget to ask for it)

well decorated and pretty big. the hamburgers here are very good and the option to get 5 litres of beer to share is great if you are going with a group. pouring your own makes for some entertaining competition.

huge bar in poble nou with a great variety of beers. and when i say huge i really really mean big. this place is bigger almost than vatican city. the decorations are also really cool and they have ping pong tables. toilets are also good but could be slightly cleaner. food is also good but a bit overpriced 10‚Ç¨ for a small burger with no chips. at least it tasted good but if you get drunk it won't fill you up completely. anyway this place is great for beers and big groups i mean, you could bring h
must visit.. great place to chill out.. huge no of tables, good beer and food.. could take up to 15 mins to serve on a busy hour..
a really fun bar! as a tourist it reminded me of a german beer hall. the place is popping around 11pm-1am, and they serve some very tasty sangria!
awesome alternative club in barcelona, a must visit for anyone looking for reasonably priced beer and awesome tunes!
great beer great team amazing music

a dirty, dark place that smelled of brewed and chopped beer. lots of noise and crowded with people.the place is very large and has a space with chairs and tables that allows you to be a little quieter.the beer was bad like in any other joint in marina but i was surprised by the non-alcoholic beer, fresh and in a bottle, without a doubt i must have been one of the few who didn't wake up with shit the next day.i suppose that for those over twenty-somethings it must be a fabulous place but for me,
the best burgers in barcelona! very very tasty! atmosphere of a real american pub. beer was good, it would be nice to extend the beer menu.
great place. nice service, beer and awesome burgers. it's a bit loud but it's a sports bar, so that's ok. :)
very good! when i ever come back to barcelona i will win the beerpongtournament #foreversecond :)
i love it! very nice atmosphere. i was there at a karaoke night organised by erasmus students. there are also beer pong events and the bartenders are very friendly.

this place has such a cool vintage vibe. it's right near the enormous flea market, encants. however, small beers cost 2,50‚Ç¨ when they normally cost 1,20 to 1,50‚Ç¨. that fact set my alarms off. the grill smells amazing but be prepared for possibly amazing prices. i'll be back for sure to check it out.
nice american themed ambiance and lots of fun with the beerpong on tuesdaysüíØ
good beer, great tapas/snacks, cheap price$, good service. 6/5 stars

i really enjoyed the friendly and direct approach by the energetic and cheerful stuff, a nice selection of local beers and non-alcoholic beverages, and an overall sensation that makes you forget about anything else, when you walk in. this place made me feel 10 years younger, maybe that's why i did like it so much. i give sonora sport tavern 5 out of 5 stars.

nice irish styled bar with excellent tv screen setup to watch games and very friendly staff! the place to be for a sports bar with good food! they even ordered my favourite belgian beer on stock because i asked! (try the ribs!!!)
key_phrases: ['belgian beer', 'tv screen setup', 'sports bar', 'irish styled bar']

text: been there for the erasmus beerpong tournament on thuesday. its has been so nice crowded then.
amazing bar!! such fun vibes and lovely music belgian beers!!!! (we love belgian beers) and much moreee!!!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

nice metal bar with good drink options. it is a large place with enough places to sit and good music. the music is not that loud which allows you to have a nice conversation. the pint of draft beer was 4.5 euros.

this is a place with a very industrial decoration and loud heavy metal music, but unlike one might think, it is not crowded. in fact, it has plenty of space and it is very comfortable for large groups of people. commonly people come here to play their famous board drinking game, which includes the board (a large piece of paper), the players pieces, which are beer crown caps), and a big blue bucket filled with wine mixed with coke. i have gone twice and i have had much fun. all in all, it is a go
key_phrases: ['heavy metal music', 'board drinking game', 'beer crown caps']

text: if you like heavy metal, this is one of the few places left in marina, the best? you can order buckets with calimocho, valencia water, beer, etc... and they give you a board that is like the game of goose but for drinking, it is super fun! highly recommended!
dirty and poor staff treatment, if not edge. compensate for music and cold beer
very good food, excellent ipa beer
nice beer pong tournament. good people and good athmosphere.
nice caf√© especially on tuesday‚Äôs when there is a beer pong tournament!
coolest vibe. beer pong tournaments, cheap drinks and reeeeeally nice tapas!!
staff is friendly. drinks are not bad. beer is good. music is really good. good spacey all around bar with decent food.
good ambience and service. music is okay. mostly regular estrella beer. a slight bit expensive compared to other places.
perfect place to have tapas, beer and a spanish experience.

very affordable prices, but i didn't like the place itself. there are no chairs as such, since they are beer crates, and the bathroom leaves something to be desired.the atmosphere is not bad, but it closes around 3 in the morning.
the only place to drink imported beers if you go out to poblenou. there is not much atmosphere. maybe with less light and adequate glasses it improved.
the former owners made the place a wonderful place to enjoy metal and imported beers.now they have tried to keep it but it is not what it was, at least they have gulden draak.

lovely little restaurant with seating inside or outside. there‚Äôs no menu but the options were explained in detail. the staff were very welcoming and the food was delicious. we loved the local beer options including a gluten free one.

what an excellent place! found it thanks to the high rating on google maps (see it does work!) and spent a bit of time talking to the owner about what to eat and what was in all the food (i‚Äôve never had venezuelan food and i don‚Äôt speak spanish as well as being a cheese hating freak), and he was so patient and friendly and even offered to put something together to suit my tastes.

great beer, great food, a really awesome owner somehow seeming to do everything himself (have a little patience) and
the homemade food (rice, meat, beans) is simple and just perfect for a supper. great beers, perfect sangria and a very nice host. definitely a place to visit!
i just love it there, there's an interesting selection of beers (the list is being updated quite frequently), and the owners are fantastic. very nice home-made food if you're hungry too!
their arepas are *amazing* and the teque√±os are little parcels of love. nice selection of beer. and super-friendly!
excellent beer, lovely people and delicious food

fast service but very little value for money, beer grande is media, bread in advance 3 slices to share with 3 people, pasta half plate with sauce with almost no taste, not all staff are friendly and at checkout it took 5 minutes for the cash register worked.
there were free tables and we were seated in a corner next to the toilets. very good pizzas and hamburgers. we will not return because we were not comfortable
very cool place. we have ordered two paellas and a hamburger and everything was great!!
good beer
spanish music, beer, good atmosphere
place to have a few beers, play table football and maybe listen to a good song from time to time. 1/2 liter beers at ‚Ç¨4 and liter beers at ‚Ç¨7
cold beer and air conditioning
excellent loin sandwiches with cheese and beer at a good price
beers are cheap, but the food is not good consistently. the bathrooms upstairs are like entering a sauna in the summer.
expired beer for 6 euros and the dirtiest pool table in barcelona.

extremely cheap place with a large variety of long drinks and shots. the place serves shots from 1 euro to 3 euros. a pint of beer is 3 euros and service is quite fast. there were not many places to sit, as the place was full, which is a good indicator of its popularity. it is full of young people, on average 20 years old. i would say it is a good place to start the night
very cheap alcohol and good music. but i would appreciate some chairs (you have plastic beer boxes instead).

one of the many bars in the marina area, perfect for an early evening before going dancing.airbar offers cocktails and shots at really low prices, shots starting from ‚Ç¨1 and one-litre cocktails for ‚Ç¨5!obviously you shouldn't expect either quality or too much attention to the interior. in fact, the place has two floors (with a mezzanine) with many tables and beer crates instead of chairs.i recommend it to people without too many expectations.good
good place to have some beers and a wide variety of shots
they have increased the liter of estrella from ‚Ç¨5 to ‚Ç¨7. there's no point in going anymore. nothing justifies sitting on broken beer boxes anymore.

i stopped by for a sandwich and a beer and i was not disappointed. staff was polite and quick to serve. sandwich was delicious and beer served in an ice cold glass. i got the chicken sandwich with everything which includes persian pickles i like very much  for 6 euros the sandwich was a steal and would definitely go back. some outside seating as well which added nicely to the experience.  good for anyone on a budget or looking for tasty sandwiches and cold beers.

update: added picture (sorry i
very good sandwiches and good beer
good space, incredible terrace, quality products.and the boy at the bar is a sun!the craft beers are also from the neighborhood 5/5 i will return
very particular place, underground in a very modern neighborhood.... good live music, top local craft beers, you feel like family, found it like this by chance and like it even more
excellent, the homemade pizzas are delicious and the craft beers.the treatment and very friendly staff. i recommend
beautiful place, the beer is delicious, and best of all the people who work there!!!don't miss out on the experience :)
great local! very good music and very good homemade beer! they have a large garden where you can comfortably enjoy a beer! highly recommended
for me one if not the best. place to drink craft beer and listen to good music. in barcelona. pere iv 93. i wish everyone like him
cultural venue, good beer, sophisticated atmosphere
lively beer hall down the street from razzmatazz. younger crowd, big groups, and lots of birthdays. great way to get the night going. short lines and lots of seating.

i enjoyed the ambience, the staff served us really well and the food was good. i ordered the menu del dia (daily combo) with paella, bread, beer and ice cream, and the price was cheap (7-10‚Ç¨). i felt really catalan eating there.

we were recommended to come here by the hotel we're staying at. maybe they get a commission because it was terrible. the service was fine and the ambience was ok but the food was terrible. it was tasteless and swimming in olive oil. we had crystal bread - sloppy and tasteless, grilled vegetables and goat cheese - all cold and tasted like they came out of a jar. the tortilla was passable. the tap beer (st miguel) was as expected but cost ‚Ç¨10 for a half a litre!

with plenty of good places to eat

food was ok.
but we were really disappointed with the fact that we were charged for a draft beer - 10 euro. the beer was not on the menu, still it was available when asking. but the fact that one beer costs 10 euro was conveniently left aside.
on average, in this area a beer costs roughly 4-5 euro.
good food, fast service, nice atmosphere. the only downside was that a draft beer was 10eur (it's usually 5-6eur). the beer was not in the menu, so we could not see the price.
good bar. beer was cold and tapas were nice.
the decline of gr√†cia. beer at ‚Ç¨4.50you can go mud grazing. if i say what i think, they don't publish my comment.

we had some beers and some hot sandwiches, loin and chicken. highly recommended, the beer is very cold and the food is delicious. very friendly service, very happy atmosphere in the square. thank you!!
very friendly bar with very good beer, and very friendly waiters

beautiful place, correct service, somewhat high coffee prices (but acceptable considering the area) and crazy beer prices!!a beer, 25 cl (inside the premises)... ‚Ç¨4.50!!!i honestly thought there was a hidden camera

clearly, one of the most magical places in gr√†cia. not only because emblematic groups have played there when they were not yet known, such as manel or amics de les arts, but because even today interesting groups or singers appear there. the beer is not very expensive and the only problem is the limited capacity due to covid
good place to listen to live music and drink craft beer.
soporific and soporific music. it makes me want to cut my wrists. the beer is good. according to a colleague, this used to be cool. if those

cozy place to have breakfast, elevenses, lunch, afternoon tea, or even dinner (before 21:30 i think)... the veggie hamburgers are great, as are the vegetarian sandwiches. i'm not so fond of the cakes, but i love this place. the staff are lovely and you can happily hang out there unhurried and even play one of the board games they have on offer. it can get busy, especially since it's child and vegetarian friendly.

super slow & unfriendly service, but they serve a really amazing organic beer. bit dirty & grotty place, not the best place i have ever been to, but not a bad place for a quick beer or coffee. staff do not speak a word of english.

delicious food, compliant staff, not rushed to leave. ideal in my books.

the bacalao - cod was thick and perfect. the mozzarella, pesto and tomato salad was a lovely meal. the craft beer was  interesting.

a very nice place, very pleasant atmosphere, the waiters' treatment perfect and the food very good, we ordered an assortment of croquettes, potato omelette, steak tartar, a hamburger with truffle sauce. highly recommended
good crowd and simple menu.  a few good beers,  wines, & catalonia liquor.  good music, but doesn't get crowded until 1am.

everything about this place is ridiculous in the best way possible: ridiculously cheap prices for beer and for tapas;  which is also very delicious, ridiculously good music, and a ridiculously friendly waiter! definitely a recommendation!
a very nice place with local people, nice beer selection and very nice staff. good place to come for one during the week and a good place to start the weekend.
great place for drinks, great selection of beers and spirits all served with the greatest selection of rock of all time
awesome tapas, beer and bartenders are super cool and friendly
very good beer, not too expensive
good unpretentious bar (rare in grace) with a relaxed atmosphere to enjoy a good beer
good vibes, good bars, there were few people, the bathrooms were very dirty... but it is a good bar for simple things, beer, mixed drinks and that's it.

on the good side: nice location, the staff was friendly and helpful, the beer was good and everything arrived quickly.
on the downside: the food was quite disappointing, it did not taste good, ot was just "acceptable". the price of food was quite high especially when you compare it to the quality. for this price i would expect some really tasty food.
tasty bbq chicken wings, brie cheese. tasty  german beer.

i like this bar so much the terrace is big so i  always go back, i tried many times the bravas, the dados de queso en mermelada de tomate, croquetas and of course the sangria and beer, even the attention from the personal ronqui y jhon very very nice they make you feel at home.
wonderful service! delicious tapas (especially the bravas). amazing mojitos and even has gluten free beer. highly recommend for an incredible atmosphere and great food.
good food, be careful of the quantity (small portion). the beers are (for this one that i‚Äôve tried : catalan ipa) really good.
beer is expensive, be careful
rock atmosphere bar where you can play darts. they have pretty good imported beers.
cool gin cocktail bar. cozy, fun decor and good service. they also have craft beer in draft which was delicious! they serve tapas but i didn‚Äôt try the food.
delicious cocktails, especially g&t. had the drink of the month and it was amazing. beer is nice and cold too!
rad little place with chill vibes and great service. good cocktails and cheap beer!
football, beer, darts, pool and friendly. no sweat
good beer selection

this bar is one of the blues corners in barcelona, ‚Äã‚Äãits decoration makes the place a typical blues bar that with a little ambient music can transport you to the most authentic louisiana.for those who like it, which is not my case, there are many imported beers, which pleasantly refreshed my friends' throats.

the place itself was not bad, but the time we went there were very annoying people who kept bothering you, there was a group that n wanted to let you play pool and they didn't play pool either, we almost ended up fighting, the beers were good
i give one, but i wouldn't give any. we ordered the draft beer and it was rotten!!! little concern from the responsible party of the site and a completely ruined night.
a good bar to meet friends. good beer menu. good atmosphere and music from the 80s and 90s.

galician tavern. the portions are the size of a tapa, but the price is not :( friendly and fast service. the best. the quality of the food, irregular. we did not like the croquettes or the artichoke omelet. the cana (small glass) of normal beer, 2.30.
it is my go-to place when i am in the area, they have excellent tapas, good beer and very attentive and willing service.highly recommended
such a tasty tapas bar! the beer is so nice and cold! the food is amazing and the serv√≠s is very warm and fast.
loved it. very tasty food, fantastic beer, friendly staff and fast service. would recommend/10

very authentic taverna/tapas bar. large selection, with many options available and visible at the barra. we tried a big selection, including several beers and wine. very good price/quantity value for the 25‚Ç¨ we ended up paying

the blue orange bar is a bar run by a galician, meaning quality food in abundance, and drinks will never be lacking.you can see that they have the best industrial beer in the world, estrella galicia, something brutal is that they have black coupage, estrella's best beer by far.not content with that, they have a wide variety of beers, i am a lover of ipas, mmmm try them...they are excellent at making coffee, with love, i recommend the coffee with toffee, as you can see in the photo you drink it
too bad the owner is not gay. highly recommended especially for their estrella galicia beer!!!
great assortment of sandwiches. highlight the hamburger with bacon and cheese!!!
a good neighborhood bar, cheap prices and good service!! with imported beers!!!

we were looking for an inexpensive local place with daily menu. we decided to go here even though relatively low rating (3.9). frankly speaking we had higher expectations. the place has a nice local vibe, responsive staff, they have our favourite moritz beer on tap.

where we were partly disappointed was the level of cooking. we ordered cold starters caprese (ok) and chickpea salad with tuna (canned chickpea, canned tuna +lettuce & tomato).
on the other hand what was great was main dish tuna, ve
the usual tapas, the usual sandwiches, no frills. good quality, good taste, good quantity.good price everything except beer. ‚Ç¨2.30 to open a bottle of estrella damm is disappointing.
good beer and delicious tapas
good tapas, good beer, not expensive.
good beer and very good tapas

we went to eat and expected something else, since it looked good from the outside. they don't make the food there. we ordered patatas bravas and when we left we saw that they had them in a plastic container. we ordered a hamburger and it was cold and so was the sandwich. it didn't smell like food, meaning they didn't make it there. it may be good to drink but i wouldn't go back to eat.

very nice waitress, who seemed to be in charge, also very attentive and nice, we had a hamburger and a burrito, if you want to be hungry and lose weight, the burrito is what you should order, for ‚Ç¨9 i expected something more than a 90 % lettuce rolled in a wrap, the rest, 10% two pieces of meat and a chopped vegetable. we will sin of "guiris"...the meat of the hamburger, good and the potatoes too.
handsome waiters, ideal location, expensive beer, inedible tapas: the omelette hides an entire salt cellar inside, it looks like they marinate the olives in cologne ü´íü•¥
a place without any pretensions. wide variety of frankfurters, hamburgers, tapas... good beer on tap.very good in the treatment and attention.
i went for the second time, at pra√ßa do sol. very pleasant place. there's spritz, but there's craft beer.
very nice small spot out of the bustle of the squares. food was really good - got a little lost in multiple orders but was worth the wait. limited beer selection but tasty nicaraguan rum.
great atmosphere and good food. a slightly traditional tapa bar. for each beer you order you get a small dish. everything we ate was tasty and enjoyable

la xula taperia presents us with high-spirited offering that madrid's renowned for in the shape of a draught beer and a tapa ‚Äì that's a free bite with each drink ‚Äì and mixes it with creative cuisine. their beers are poured to perfection, and their small and casual tapas are well-suited to their creative style. examples include the tuna tataki and mustard tart, and the 'pringa' burrito made with andalusian grilled beef, spinach and cheese.
key_phrases: ['tuna tataki', 'tapa', 'mustard tart', 'la xula taperia', 'draught beer', 'as', 'creative cuisine']

text: very tasty paella. shared one between four and a bunch of simple tapas items and beer and wine. great price and nice atmosphere
the ribs are amazing, they fall straight from the bone and are simply delicious, beer is a reasonable price and service was good. thanks for lunch guys

this place is awesome! we found it it by chance and we really enjoyed the vibes there, it's a real barcelona bar, very popular among the locals. the food is great and they have good beers at a very reasonable price. the manager is such a legend! we enjoyed so much listening to good spanish music there. see you soon
i loved it! the owner is great, the beer is great and the place is super nice. one of the best gracias bars in barcelona. i love music! i will definitely return :)))
unbelievable you feel at home. gerard and enric are great, between the tapas, the beer and the music it's quite a show. highly recommended!!

the offer of this bar is not only culinary, it offers an atmosphere framed by a well-chosen musical score, with a well-insulated ceiling so as not to disturb the neighbors. the braves are very good. it also offers its walls for graphic artists, painters, etc. it is also very interesting that they can offer belgian siphon beer.

the best patatas bravas i've ever had, great service and a very nice place. best potatoes i have ever tried tje location in gracia the best one the beer is craft beer so awesome and the hosts are super nice love it üòçüòçüòçüòç
the atmosphere, the music, the food and of course the good beer are super cool. don't hesitate to visit this place if you visit the gracia neighborhood.
a place with delicious, homemade tapas, there are craft beers.the staff is very friendly and attentive
the few times i have gone it has not disappointed, and the draft beer, 1906, is very good. i recommend.
a very cozy bar where you can drink chouffe beer on tap üòä... crazy dwarfs.... dj's nights and good atmosphere.
traditional establishment. quality food and drink. very good selection of beers.
good sandwiches and good beers!! very good attention!

pufff, i'd rather go to a club and dance a little bit of everything that will cost me less than a drink in this place!!!!! paying 5 euros for a heineken beer and hot on top of that... what a disaster, i wouldn't return to this place.
